name: Relapse the Neverland: Demo
description:
Discord | Twitter | Kickstarter | Steam(TBD)

Relapse the Neverland is a narrative driven, "zelda-like" survival horror game with a dark fairy tale-like aesthetic that delves into healing trauma, diverse puzzles, dynamic choices and exploring a World War 2 era orphanage.

Heavily inspired by games such as Clocktower, Silent Hill, and Zelda: Majora's Mask.

 
    • A unique, detailed style of pixel art
    • Explore the Neverland Orphanage, a huge creepy orphanage managed by the orphans, delivered with level design that tells a short story in every room.
    • Gameplay mechanics such as "Relapsing" and the Tool System. Giving the player multiple paths and choices to navigate.
    • A huge amount of dedication to bring true dynamic choice to the world. With expectations to make each and every choice actually have a cause and effect.
    • A living world that functions within a 12 hour time system.

When the bell tolls, if you've acquired the lute you will face two choices. Do you relapse back to the first hour or continue on? Relapsing back to the first hour will revert all the decisions you've made from then.

All materials and consumables will be lost, however all tools and key items will be kept. Relapsing allows you to reattempt some puzzles as some may have different ways to be solved, yielding different results!

                                    Time System

The time system is not just a countdown until "Game Over". Within an 11 hour time period you will encounter various events depending on the time of day, until the monsters overrun the orphanage completely. The orphans you interact with have their own schedules! You will not be able to complete every interaction or quest without relapsing. Your choices, including what interactions you choose to have will have an impact on your ending. Choose carefully now!

                                              Monsters

Monsters will evolve and get deadlier as time presses forward. You may also encounter unique monsters within specific areas of the game, each with their own quirks that you must learn to overcome.
